long: Meaning: to "kneel"; by implication to "bless" God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to "curse" (God or the king, as treason).  Usage: × abundantly, × altogether, × at all, blaspheme, bless, congratulate, curse, × greatly, × indeed, kneel (down), praise, salute, × still, thank.  Source: a primitive root;
